newsitem.title: FRANCE: MOTORCYCLING-DOOHAN OUTCLASSES THE REST AGAIN.
newsitem.headline: MOTORCYCLING-DOOHAN OUTCLASSES THE REST AGAIN.

text.p: Australia's Michael Doohan again outclassed his rivals on Saturday to qualify fastest for Sunday's 500 cc French motorcycling Grand Prix.
The reigning world champion and current championship leader clocked one minute and 21.082 seconds on the 3.786-km French Riviera track to obtain the 41st fastest qualifying time of his career.
Winner of four out of five races this season, Doohan will again be hot favourite for Sunday's French Grand Prix, which he won last year,
"The bike was doing fine today. All night the team perfected the set up and it showed on the track," said the Honda rider.
"If the weather stays the same, I'm confident I can win for the second year running here."
Doohan's team mate Alex Criville of Spain was second fastest on 1:21.166.
"I'm satisfied," said Criville, who won the Spanish Grand Prix in May.
"I'm not too far from Doohan and with a little bit of luck I hope to be able to close the gap as I did in Spain."
In the 250cc race, Frenchman Olivier Jacque was fastest followed by world champion Max Biaggi of Italy.
